summary: The document is a 'Supplemental Personal History Statement' form, associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It provides detailed personal, familial, and employment information about Daniel Flores, including his marriage to Dorothy Arnett Flores, their two daughters, Kendra and Zola Marie Flores, and their residences in various locations such as Guayaquil, Ecuador, and Lima, Peru. It also covers Daniel Flores's employment as a Legal Secretary at Arnold and Porter in Washington, D.C., and includes declarations regarding legal incidents and an emergency contact.
key_findings: Daniel Flores was born in August 1935 in San Marcos, Texas.
Married to Dorothy Arnett Flores, born in January 1935 in Portland, Oregon, on 18 November 1960 in Lima, Peru.
They have two daughters: Kendra Flores, born in March 1971, and Zola Marie Flores, born in March 1974, both in Washington, D.C.
Worked as a Legal Secretary at Arnold and Porter, located at 1229 19th Street NW, Washington, D.C.
The family lived in Guayaquil, Ecuador, and Lima, Peru, between May 1969 and February 1974.
Includes declarations about arrests, indictments, or convictions since the last Personal History Statement (PHS) and any unfavorable incidents requiring explanation.
Emergency contact listed as Mr. Nestor Sanchez, with additional details about other close relatives for notification in case of emergency.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
